data.name: Alkane Validator
data.description:
Alkane Validator

Background

Alkanes are a family of organic molecules made up of Carbon and Hydrogen atoms. Each Carbon atom must bond with 4 other atoms. Each Hydrogen atom must bond to 1 Carbon atom. Alkanes can not have any double bonds. The smallest Alkane is Methane. It is 1 Carbon atom bonded to 4 Hydrogen atoms. It can be represented by the molecular formula CH4. The next Alkane is Ethane. It is 2 Carbon atoms bonded to 6 Hydrogen atoms. It can be represented by the molecular formula C2H6. An Alkane with N Carbon Atoms will have (2N + 2) Hydrogen Atoms.

Task

Your task is to write a function that will return true or false depending on whether a valid molecular formula for an Alkane has been passed in as a string.

Constraints

  • The formula must start with the number of Carbon atoms first
  • There is no limit to the number of carbon atoms that can be linked together
  • The molecule must follow the rule C(n)H(2n + 2)
  • Methane is a special case and has the molecular formula CH4 (we don't bother to write the 1 next to the Carbon atom)
  • The C and H must be uppercase
